"The Red Violin" is a movie in which a violin is the main character. The movie was filmed from the violinâ€™s point of view. From its birth during the 1600s in Cremona the world capital for Italian handcrafted violins. To its ownership by an English lord in Britain during the 1800s Victorian royal era. Then, its near destruction in Shanghai during the 1900s Cultural Revolution. And eventually, its restoration and auction for $2.4 million in modern day Montreal.

Violins are like humans. Each has its own history and they have life spans longer than humans. From now onwards, their stories won't be lost in time but remembered through Blocktag's authentication tag technolgy. The tag is printed and attached to a violin. Scan the Blocktagged violin with your phone camera and you can watch the real life version of "The Red Violin".

J.S. Bach Sonata No.3 - Largo (Clip) from 5106315417 on Vimeo. The 2020AD Pandemic Era performance

Blocktag is the eternal memory body of the violin.

When a violin is attached to Blocktag's unclonable printed tag, the violin can be uniquely identified. Its stories which are digitally recorded is unchangeable (non fungible). When this unchangeable unit (token) of data is stored on a digital ledger, it is known as a Non Fungible Token (NFT). The topic of combining a tagged physical violin and its attached digital data to form a physical NFT is discussed at https://www.blocktag.com/blog/violin-physical-nft/
